page.title: 02Local History
page.content: During the iron age,about 200 years before Christ a large hill top camp was built near to the burrough spring.Just beyond one of the farms just outside Ratby the remains of this are to be found.Unfortunately the farmer on whose land the camp is situated is very anxious about attracting crowds and allows absolutely nobody to see it. Both Ratby and Kirby have an entry in the Domesday book.Ratby was the larger of the two places in those days and had a priest_indicating the prsence of an early church.The main body of the church dates from the 14th century .Historians suggest that the incoplete stonework in the nave may be due to the visitation of the plague. Both the important Leics families, the Greys and Hastings owned land here
